result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Gary Batcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay a fine of $600.00.
*Pay all costs, fees, surcharges, and fines during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.
*Court ordered bail on deposit to apply. 
*If revoked, court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds/earnings.

*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.
*Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: *FORTHWITH. Defendant to have release for programming/treatment he is currently receiving at the VA.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Gary Batcher not in court.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.

records.addlTxt:
As to COUNT 2-
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Joseph Gary Batcher in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. State placed negotiations on the record. 
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1- 
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.
Letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
WCS Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Joseph Gary Batcher in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Francesco Mineo on behalf of Irene Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Defense counsel is not raising competency at this time, but is requesting additional time to prepare with the defendant and review the paperwork. State does not object to an adjournment. ADA Mineo will be handling this matter for the State. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Joseph Gary Batcher in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Timothy J. Cotter on behalf of Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Discussion regarding the defendant's progress with treatment. State will turnover a final offer to defense counsel. Defense counsel anticipates a resolution in this matter and requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Per the substitution against Judge Conen (post-rotation) filed by defense.
against Judge Conen (post-rotation) filed by defense.  The newly assigned court is Judge Rothstein's Court.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Joseph Gary Batcher not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request an adjournment.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.

  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2013, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Defense filed a request for substitution of judge today.
The newly assigned court is Judge Rothstein's Court.

Case adjourned to 08-13-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 25, Judge Rothstein's Court for Scheduling Conference.

Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date form signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS Status Report, received and filed.

Parties request a Status Conference date.
Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 05-28-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

FILED, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program.
FILED, Defendant's Substance Abuse Treatment Progress Report.

Defendant Joseph Gary Batcher in court with attorney Ann Jaspers for Bridget Joy Krause.  Ron Dague for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM014305  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-17-15

No driving without a valid license.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joseph Gary Batcher in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Joseph Gary Batcher in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
